turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1980s professional wrestling boom.
turn.1: What was the main event of the 1980s professional wrestling boom?
turn.2: The main event was a title-for-title match between WWF World Heavyweight Champion Hulk Hogan and Intercontinental Heavyweight Champion The Ultimate Warrior.
turn.4: It not only pitted the WWF's two biggest faces against each other, but was intended as the "passing of the torch" from Hogan, the star of the 1980s, to Warrior, who was immensely popular and considered to be Hogan's successor.
turn.5: Did anyone else play a role in the 1980s professional wrestling boom?
turn.6: Hogan's clean pin fall loss signaled the end of an era.
turn.8: However, Hogan lingered on in the WWF for the next three years, winning the title for another three times.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: By the early 1990s, Hogan started appearing with much less frequency on WWF events, with Warrior taking the main-event spot through all of 1990 and 1991.
turn.12: In 1992, allegations of anabolic steroid abuse and sexual harassment were harming the WWF's family-friendly image.
